intro: Pionandra narensis, commonly known as the Nares Island hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Nares in the South Pacific. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a smooth texture. Pionandra narensis is adapted to coastal environments and thrives in sandy, well-drained soils.
